I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

Fresh graduates wake up daily with the anxiety of securing an interview, applying to hundreds of roles, only to face rejection and imposter syndrome. Despite investing lakhs in their education/courses like MBA / M. com and many more they are often offered minimal salaries or placed in non-strategic roles like telecalling.This brings up a crucial question—are companies genuinely hiring freshers, or are these job postings merely for visibility? I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment
