The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Fresh graduates wake up daily with the anxiety of securing an interview, applying to hundreds of roles, only to face rejection and imposter syndrome. Despite investing lakhs in their education/courses like MBA / M. com and many more they are often offered minimal salaries or placed in non-strategic roles like telecalling.This brings up a crucial question—are companies genuinely hiring freshers, or are these job postings merely for visibility? Moreover, why is the hiring process shifting towards engagement tactics like asking candidates to comment # Interested instead of directly evaluating applications?Freshers should be hired, not ignored—because experience is built through training, dedication, and hard work, not just prior employment. |Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

Here’s what’s required:🔹 Demand Letter – Defines job role, salary, responsibilities, and employment conditions.🔹 Power of Attorney (POA) – Authorizes a recruitment agency to act on behalf of the employer.🔹 Commercial Registration (CR) – Confirms the company is legally registered.🔹 Visa Block Approval – Obtained from the Ministry of Human Resources & Social Development (HRSD).🔹 Wakala – Issued through the Musaned System for recruitment authorization.Ensuring these steps are followed guarantees a smooth and compliant overseas hiring process.Which of these steps do you think is the most challenging in overseas recruitment? The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗻 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴Ah, the noble recruiter: tirelessly hunting for that mythical “unicorn” who codes in 10 languages, has 15 years of experience in a 5-year-old framework, and moonlights as a neurosurgeon—all while vibing with our “chill, fast-paced startup culture.”But wait! The real magic is their pitch: “𝘞𝘦 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯!” Translation: “𝘞𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 SpaceX 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘢𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘤𝘺𝘤𝘭𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴.” Why pay top dollar when you can dangle vague promises of “exposure” or equity in a company whose roadmap ends at “maybe break even by 2035”?Let’s recap this fair game:Requirements: Solve world hunger, reverse climate change, and maintain eye contact during Zoom calls.Compensation: “Competitive” = slightly above poverty line, but hey, we’ve got beanbags!Timeline: Need you yesterday. Also, 8 rounds of interviews to prove you’re not a bot.Of course, when no one applies, recruiters are shocked. “𝘞𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘷𝘪𝘣𝘦𝘴?” Maybe hunting Bigfoot? Or busy laughing at your salary band?Pro tip, folks: If you want a candidate who’s “self-motivated, resilient, and thrives under pressure,” try offering more than a pizza party and a pat on the back. Otherwise, enjoy your 12-month search for a ghost who doesn’t exist.But what do I know? I’m just someone who thinks “fair” shouldn’t mean “delusional.”

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

𝐃𝐨 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐤𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐛𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐚𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐭𝐨 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞𝐚𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐊𝐒𝐀 🤔?Before bringing talent from overseas to Saudi Arabia, employers must complete essential legal and procedural steps. Here’s what’s required:🔹 Demand Letter – Defines job role, salary, responsibilities, and employment conditions.🔹 Power of Attorney (POA) – Authorizes a recruitment agency to act on behalf of the employer.🔹 Commercial Registration (CR) – Confirms the company is legally registered.🔹 Visa Block Approval – Obtained from the Ministry of Human Resources & Social Development (HRSD).🔹 Wakala – Issued through the Musaned System for recruitment authorization.Ensuring these steps are followed guarantees a smooth and compliant overseas hiring process.Which of these steps do you think is the most challenging in overseas recruitment? The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗻 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴Ah, the noble recruiter: tirelessly hunting for that mythical “unicorn” who codes in 10 languages, has 15 years of experience in a 5-year-old framework, and moonlights as a neurosurgeon—all while vibing with our “chill, fast-paced startup culture.”But wait! The real magic is their pitch: “𝘞𝘦 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯!” Translation: “𝘞𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 SpaceX 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘢𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘤𝘺𝘤𝘭𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴.” Why pay top dollar when you can dangle vague promises of “exposure” or equity in a company whose roadmap ends at “maybe break even by 2035”?Let’s recap this fair game:Requirements: Solve world hunger, reverse climate change, and maintain eye contact during Zoom calls.Compensation: “Competitive” = slightly above poverty line, but hey, we’ve got beanbags!Timeline: Need you yesterday. Also, 8 rounds of interviews to prove you’re not a bot.Of course, when no one applies, recruiters are shocked. “𝘞𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘷𝘪𝘣𝘦𝘴?” Maybe hunting Bigfoot? Or busy laughing at your salary band?Pro tip, folks: If you want a candidate who’s “self-motivated, resilient, and thrives under pressure,” try offering more than a pizza party and a pat on the back. Otherwise, enjoy your 12-month search for a ghost who doesn’t exist.But what do I know? I’m just someone who thinks “fair” shouldn’t mean “delusional.”

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Fresh graduates wake up daily with the anxiety of securing an interview, applying to hundreds of roles, only to face rejection and imposter syndrome. Despite investing lakhs in their education/courses like MBA / M. com and many more they are often offered minimal salaries or placed in non-strategic roles like telecalling.This brings up a crucial question—are companies genuinely hiring freshers, or are these job postings merely for visibility? Moreover, why is the hiring process shifting towards engagement tactics like asking candidates to comment # Interested instead of directly evaluating applications?Freshers should be hired, not ignored—because experience is built through training, dedication, and hard work, not just prior employment. |Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

Here’s what’s required:🔹 Demand Letter – Defines job role, salary, responsibilities, and employment conditions.🔹 Power of Attorney (POA) – Authorizes a recruitment agency to act on behalf of the employer.🔹 Commercial Registration (CR) – Confirms the company is legally registered.🔹 Visa Block Approval – Obtained from the Ministry of Human Resources & Social Development (HRSD).🔹 Wakala – Issued through the Musaned System for recruitment authorization.Ensuring these steps are followed guarantees a smooth and compliant overseas hiring process.Which of these steps do you think is the most challenging in overseas recruitment? The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗻 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴Ah, the noble recruiter: tirelessly hunting for that mythical “unicorn” who codes in 10 languages, has 15 years of experience in a 5-year-old framework, and moonlights as a neurosurgeon—all while vibing with our “chill, fast-paced startup culture.”But wait! The real magic is their pitch: “𝘞𝘦 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯!” Translation: “𝘞𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 SpaceX 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘢𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘤𝘺𝘤𝘭𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴.” Why pay top dollar when you can dangle vague promises of “exposure” or equity in a company whose roadmap ends at “maybe break even by 2035”?Let’s recap this fair game:Requirements: Solve world hunger, reverse climate change, and maintain eye contact during Zoom calls.Compensation: “Competitive” = slightly above poverty line, but hey, we’ve got beanbags!Timeline: Need you yesterday. Also, 8 rounds of interviews to prove you’re not a bot.Of course, when no one applies, recruiters are shocked. “𝘞𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘷𝘪𝘣𝘦𝘴?” Maybe hunting Bigfoot? Or busy laughing at your salary band?Pro tip, folks: If you want a candidate who’s “self-motivated, resilient, and thrives under pressure,” try offering more than a pizza party and a pat on the back. Otherwise, enjoy your 12-month search for a ghost who doesn’t exist.But what do I know? I’m just someone who thinks “fair” shouldn’t mean “delusional.”

🚀 Elevate Your Talent Acquisition Strategy: Key Steps for SuccessAttracting top talent today requires more than competitive salaries. Candidates seek purpose, growth, and a great workplace experience. Here’s how to stand out:Build a Strong Employer Brand✅ Define Your EVP: Clearly communicate your mission, culture, and employee benefits.✅ Leverage Digital Presence: Showcase company culture on LinkedIn and social media.✅ Optimize Your Careers Page: Make job opportunities and values clear and compelling.Enhance Employee Engagement✅ Foster a Positive Culture: Open communication and inclusivity drive retention.✅ Recognize & Reward Talent: Appreciation and career growth boost motivation.✅ Invest in Development: Mentorship and upskilling keep employees engaged.Streamline Hiring✅ Move Fast: A slow process loses great candidates.✅ Prioritize Candidate Experience: Clear, engaging, and transparent hiring matters.✅ Champion Diversity: Inclusive hiring strengthens innovation and culture.💡 Bottom Line: Companies that invest in people and culture attract and retain the best talent.  hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#EmployerBranding hashtag#HiringSuccess hashtag#RecruitmentStrategy hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#CompanyCulture hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#Careers hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#Grow

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

📢 ¡En Ágape Reclutadores estamos en búsqueda de un/a Project Manager para sumarse a importante compañía de software! 🚀Si eres una persona dinámica, orientada a resultados, con habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de desarrollo de software, ¡queremos conocerte!🔹 Responsabilidades del rol: ✅ Velar por el cumplimiento de los procesos establecidos para el desarrollo de proyectos. ✅ Identificar riesgos, mitigarlos y solucionarlos. ✅ Gestionar cambios en el alcance y generar nuevo revenue. ✅ Garantizar la rentabilidad de los servicios. ✅ Asegurar la satisfacción de las cuentas asignadas. ✅ Controlar presupuestos y generar informes de avance. ✅ Detectar oportunidades de negocio (cross y up-selling). ✅ Definir y documentar arquitecturas, validándolas con el líder técnico. ✅ Diseñar soluciones técnicas para los requerimientos de los proyectos. ✅ Estimar historias de usuario y construir Gantts. ✅ Colaborar con los analistas funcionales en la construcción, priorización y refinamiento de backlogs. ✅ Realizar estimaciones de alto nivel y órdenes de magnitud. ✅ Supervisar o realizar despliegues. ✅ Rastrear, consumir e interpretar logs. ✅ Velar por el correcto mantenimiento de repositorios y branching policies.🔹 Requisitos: ✔️ +5 años de experiencia como Project Manager en proyectos de desarrollo de software con metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Experiencia en gestión de múltiples proyectos simultáneamente. ✔️ Experiencia previa en desarrollo o análisis funcional. ✔️ Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso en Sistemas, Management, Ingeniería, Cs. Económicas, Ciencias Exactas o afines. ✔️ Certificación en PMI, PMP o metodologías ágiles. ✔️ Tecnologías requeridas: Agile. ✔️ Tecnologías deseables: Kanban, SQL, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Angular, NodeJS, Java, .NET, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Azure, Huawei, GCP. ✔️ Competencias clave: proactividad, orientación a resultados, liderazgo de equipo, capacidad de delegar, resolución de conflictos, autonomía, planificación de tareas, control de costos, orientación al negocio y satisfacción del cliente.🔹 Condiciones: 💼 Relación de dependencia. 📍 Modalidad híbrida - Buenos Aires, Argentina.📩 Si cumples con el perfil, envía tu CV a hresources.tr@gmail.com o postúlate directamente en este post. ¡También puedes etiquetar a alguien que pueda estar interesado!hashtag#ProjectManager hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TrabajoHíbrido hashtag#DesarrolloDeSoftware hashtag#Agile hashtag#PM hashtag#OportunidadLaboral

|Simplifying Dependency Injection in Spring| Dependency Injection (DI) is a cornerstone of the Spring Framework, promoting clean and modular code. Here's a quick overview of its types: 1. Constructor Injection: Dependencies are passed via constructors. Perfect for mandatory dependencies and ensuring immutability. 2. Setter Injection: Dependencies are set via setter methods. Great for optional or changeable dependencies during runtime. 3. Field Injection: Dependencies are directly injected into class fields using annotations like @Autowired. While concise, it tightly couples the code to Spring. Choosing the right approach depends on your use case. Constructor injection is favored for its clarity and immutability, while setter injection offers flexibility, and field injection simplifies implementation. How do you decide on the right injection method for your projects? Let’s discuss. hashtag#SpringFramework hashtag#DependencyInjection hashtag#JavaDevelopment

Here’s what’s required:🔹 Demand Letter – Defines job role, salary, responsibilities, and employment conditions.🔹 Power of Attorney (POA) – Authorizes a recruitment agency to act on behalf of the employer.🔹 Commercial Registration (CR) – Confirms the company is legally registered.🔹 Visa Block Approval – Obtained from the Ministry of Human Resources & Social Development (HRSD).🔹 Wakala – Issued through the Musaned System for recruitment authorization.Ensuring these steps are followed guarantees a smooth and compliant overseas hiring process.Which of these steps do you think is the most challenging in overseas recruitment? The Real Reason Freshers Struggle in InterviewsA few days ago, I spoke to a fresher preparing for job interviews. He had strong technical knowledge in Java, Data Structures, and SQL but had failed multiple interviews.Curious, I asked him to simulate an interview with me.📌 His problem wasn’t lack of knowledge—it was poor communication. He hesitated, struggled to frame sentences, and lacked confidence.👉 This is where many job seekers, especially freshers, go wrong. Interview success isn’t just about technical skills—it’s about how well you communicate them!Here’s what makes a difference:✅ Structured Responses – Employers look for clear, concise answers.✅ Confident Delivery – Your tone and clarity matter.✅ Body Language & Fluency – A strong presence leaves a lasting impression.After working on these, he cracked his next interview!💬 Do you think technical skills alone are enough to crack a job interview? hashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#SoftSkills hashtag#JobSeekers hashtag#CommunicationSkills hashtag#InterviewPreparation hashtag#Freshers hashtag#Hiring hashtag#CampusPlacement hashtag#HR hashtag#TechnicalInterviews

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗟𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗼𝗳 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗻 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴Ah, the noble recruiter: tirelessly hunting for that mythical “unicorn” who codes in 10 languages, has 15 years of experience in a 5-year-old framework, and moonlights as a neurosurgeon—all while vibing with our “chill, fast-paced startup culture.”But wait! The real magic is their pitch: “𝘞𝘦 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯!” Translation: “𝘞𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 SpaceX 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘢𝘵 𝘣𝘪𝘤𝘺𝘤𝘭𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴.” Why pay top dollar when you can dangle vague promises of “exposure” or equity in a company whose roadmap ends at “maybe break even by 2035”?Let’s recap this fair game:Requirements: Solve world hunger, reverse climate change, and maintain eye contact during Zoom calls.Compensation: “Competitive” = slightly above poverty line, but hey, we’ve got beanbags!Timeline: Need you yesterday. Also, 8 rounds of interviews to prove you’re not a bot.Of course, when no one applies, recruiters are shocked. “𝘞𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘷𝘪𝘣𝘦𝘴?” Maybe hunting Bigfoot? Or busy laughing at your salary band?Pro tip, folks: If you want a candidate who’s “self-motivated, resilient, and thrives under pressure,” try offering more than a pizza party and a pat on the back. Otherwise, enjoy your 12-month search for a ghost who doesn’t exist.But what do I know? I’m just someone who thinks “fair” shouldn’t mean “delusional.”

The Hire You Regret vs. The Hire You Never Make!Companies often regret hiring the wrong person. But do you know what's worse? Never hiring the right one.I've seen businesses hesitate; waiting for the "perfect" candidate, delaying decisions, and losing top talent to faster-moving competitors.The truth? High performers don’t wait. And in today’s fast-paced world, the opportunity cost of inaction is higher than the cost of a mistake.Hire for potential. Hire for adaptability. Hire before your competitor does.hashtag#Stat: "The average financial cost of a bad hire is up to 30% of the employee’s first-year earnings. According to another report, companies hiring for adaptability grow revenue 2.5x faster than peers. Yet 75% of hiring managers still reject candidates for ‘not checking every box".What do you think’s worse: a bad hire or a missed hire? Post Content:
🚀 Elevate Your Talent Acquisition Strategy: Key Steps for SuccessAttracting top talent today requires more than competitive salaries. Candidates seek purpose, growth, and a great workplace experience. Here’s how to stand out:Build a Strong Employer Brand✅ Define Your EVP: Clearly communicate your mission, culture, and employee benefits.✅ Leverage Digital Presence: Showcase company culture on LinkedIn and social media.✅ Optimize Your Careers Page: Make job opportunities and values clear and compelling.Enhance Employee Engagement✅ Foster a Positive Culture: Open communication and inclusivity drive retention.✅ Recognize & Reward Talent: Appreciation and career growth boost motivation.✅ Invest in Development: Mentorship and upskilling keep employees engaged.Streamline Hiring✅ Move Fast: A slow process loses great candidates.✅ Prioritize Candidate Experience: Clear, engaging, and transparent hiring matters.✅ Champion Diversity: Inclusive hiring strengthens innovation and culture.💡 Bottom Line: Companies that invest in people and culture attract and retain the best talent.  hashtag#TalentAcquisition hashtag#EmployerBranding hashtag#HiringSuccess hashtag#RecruitmentStrategy hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#CompanyCulture hashtag#LeadershipDevelopment hashtag#Careers hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#Grow
